title: Checkpoint: Higher Math Part 2 (Geometry, Statistics & Probability)
description: Assessment covering all skills from Units 4-5: Geometry and Statistics & Probability. ACT-format questions with progressive difficulty.

remediationStrategy.description: Students scoring below threshold receive focused reteaching on their weakest skill clusters before proceeding.

clusters.reteachFocus: Transversal angle pairs, triangle angle sum, exterior angle theorem
Interior angle formula, circle circumference/area, arc length/sector area
Formula memorization: triangle, trapezoid, cylinder, cone, sphere
Distance formula, midpoint, completing the square for circles
SOH-CAH-TOA setup, special right triangles, Pythagorean triples
Weighted average, median from sorted data, standard deviation concept
Box plot reading (Q1, median, Q3, IQR), scatter plot trends
Complementary probability, P(A or B) with overlap, counting principle

assessmentProblems.question:
Two supplementary angles are in the ratio 2:7. What is the measure of the smaller angle?
(A) 20°  (B) 40°  (C) 70°  (D) 90°  (E) 140°

What is the area of a trapezoid with bases 8 and 14 and height 5?
(A) 40  (B) 55  (C) 70  (D) 110  (E) 140

The mean of 8 numbers is 15. What is their sum?
(A) 23  (B) 80  (C) 112  (D) 120  (E) 150

A circle has radius 7. What is its circumference in terms of π?
(A) 7π  (B) 14π  (C) 28π  (D) 49π  (E) 98π

What is the midpoint of the segment from (−4, 6) to (10, −2)?
(A) (3, 2)  (B) (7, 4)  (C) (6, 4)  (D) (3, 4)  (E) (7, −4)

A right triangle has legs 5 and 12. What is tan of the angle opposite the leg of length 5?
(A) 5/12  (B) 5/13  (C) 12/13  (D) 12/5  (E) 13/12

A bag has 4 red and 6 blue marbles. What is the probability of drawing a red marble?
(A) 1/4  (B) 2/5  (C) 3/5  (D) 2/3  (E) 4/6

The hypotenuse of a 45-45-90 triangle is 10. What is the length of each leg?
(A) 5  (B) 5√2  (C) 5√3  (D) 10√2  (E) 10/√2

A sector has radius 10 and central angle 72°. What is the area of the sector?
(A) 10π  (B) 20π  (C) 50π  (D) 72π  (E) 100π

A data set has values: 3, 5, 5, 7, 10, 12. If the value 12 is changed to 30, which measure changes the MOST?
(A) Mean  (B) Median  (C) Mode  (D) Range  (E) Mean and Range equally
assessmentProblems.answer: (A) Mean changes most significantly (increases from 7 to 10), and range also changes (from 9 to 27). However, comparing: mean changes by 3, range changes by 18. Actually range changes more. Answer: (D) Range.

assessmentProblems.question:
What is the distance between (1, −3) and (−4, 9)?
(A) 10  (B) 11  (C) 12  (D) 13  (E) 14

A two-way table shows 200 students surveyed about sports preference:

            | Soccer | Basketball | Total
  Boys      |   45   |    55      |  100
  Girls     |   60   |    40      |  100
  Total     |  105   |    95      |  200

What is the probability that a randomly selected Soccer fan is a girl?
(A) 3/10  (B) 4/7  (C) 12/20  (D) 60/200  (E) 60/100

A cylinder has volume 250π cm³ and height 10 cm. What is the radius?
(A) 5  (B) 10  (C) 15  (D) 25  (E) √25

An observer stands 50 feet from the base of a building. The angle of elevation to the top is 60°. What is the height of the building?
(A) 25 feet  (B) 25√3 feet  (C) 50√3 feet  (D) 100 feet  (E) 50/√3 feet

Two cards are drawn from a standard 52-card deck without replacement. What is the probability both are aces?
(A) 1/169  (B) 1/221  (C) 4/52  (D) 1/13  (E) 2/52

A circle has equation x² + y² + 8x − 6y = 0. What is the radius?
(A) 3  (B) 4  (C) 5  (D) 7  (E) 25
